Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; rv:1.7.3) Gecko/20040913 Firefox/0.10

I try to compile the Firefox 0.10PR release myself ( I always do this) but
I get the following error

symbol _libVersionPoint used from dynamic library
../../dist/bin/libplc4.dylib(plvrsion.o) not from earlier dynamic library
@executable_path/libplds4.dylib(plvrsion.o)
make[1]: *** [firefox-bin] Error 1
make[1]: Leaving directory `/Users/dave/src/mozilla/browser/app'
make: *** [all] Error 2
dave:[~/src/mozilla/browser/app/]$ 



Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Compile Firefox 0.10PR on a Mac OS X Panther
2.
3.

comments.text:
You should not set +/- blocking flags.  Those are reserved for the drivers.  If
you think a bug should block a release, use the ? flag.

Anyway, I don't know much about builds on Macs, but have you at least tried a
make clean?
comments.author: quark29@comcast.net
comments.creator: quark29@comcast.net
comments.raw_text:
You should not set +/- blocking flags.  Those are reserved for the drivers.  If
you think a bug should block a release, use the ? flag.

Anyway, I don't know much about builds on Macs, but have you at least tried a
make clean?

comments.text:
Yes I have tried a make clean , I went so far as to delete the source and
recheck backout everything just to be sure. Sorry about the flag bit I wasn't
sure what to do, I do think this is a bit important at least to those who
compile firefox themselves on macs.

comments.text:
This is totally my fault, I had compiled with typeahead find as one of the
extensions, when I removed it, firefox compiled ok. sorry.
comments.author: dave.chand.mailinglist@gmail.com
comments.creator: dave.chand.mailinglist@gmail.com
